moves.1. e4: !!! Yes, I give my 1. e4 a triple exclam !!! Why, you may ask? Here'e the deal - I didn't discover OTB until 1991, when I played in my first tournament. My second tournament wasn't until 2006, and since then I've played in almost 100 OTB tourneys. That's roughly 500 rated games, meaning roughly 250 with white. I had NEVER played 1. e4 during all that time. Doug, a loooooong time nemesis, is well aware of this fact. I am 1-0-6 against him in rated play (yes, you read that right). He wants me BAAAAD. When I whipped out 1. e4, he looked JUST LIKE robertor's newest pic:) He spent almost 7 minutes on his first move:)
?! We discussed this one at length afterwards. I still don't like it.
moves.16. Qe3 Ne7 17. Nxe7+ Qxe7 18. f4 Rhf8 1: ?! We REALLY talked about this one. As much as I disliked it, I still couldn't refute it in the endgame.
moves.41. g4 b6 42. b4: ?! I kinda wish I had that one back.
moves.42... a5 43. a3: (43. bxa leads into very murky waters. Several A and B players analyzed this one with both Doug and me.)
moves.43... axb4 44. axb4 h6: The gift of a waiting move.
